recipe.name: Vegan Burrito
recipe.description: A hearty and flavorful vegan burrito packed with Spanish rice, seasoned black beans, charred red bell peppers, fresh spinach, creamy guacamole, pickled red onions, and a touch of heat from jalapeños, all wrapped in a warm flour tortilla.

ingredients.ingredient_name: Cooked black beans, drained and rinsed

steps: In a medium bowl, combine the black beans with fresh lime juice, taco seasoning, and a pinch of sea salt. Stir to combine and set aside.

Heat a skillet over medium-high heat and add 1 tablespoon of olive oil. Add the sliced red bell peppers and cook, stirring occasionally, until charred and tender, about 5-7 minutes. Season with sea salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste.
Warm the flour tortillas in a dry skillet or microwave until pliable.

To assemble each burrito, lay a tortilla on a flat surface. Place a handful of fresh spinach leaves in the center, followed by 1/2 cup of Spanish rice, 1/4 cup of the seasoned black beans, a few slices of charred red bell pepper, 1/4 cup of guacamole, a tablespoon of pickled red onions, a sprinkle of chopped cilantro, and a few jalapeño slices, if desired.
Fold the sides of the tortilla over the filling, then fold up the bottom flap. Tuck and roll the burrito closed, ensuring the filling is securely enclosed.
Repeat with the remaining tortillas and fillings.
Serve the burritos immediately, or wrap them tightly in foil for later consumption. They can be stored in the refrigerator for up to 2 days.
